comment: Chose a different elective, please. I am trying to save you. She should not teach.

I do entertainment marketing. What a sad excuse of an E.M. class. Want to learn entertainment marketing? All you get here are the 4Cs. Want to learn superficial entertainment industry topics? You're in luck! Integrated and reliable schedule? No, not here. 

Hot tip: Laura LOVES busy work (word and footnote counts, excessive papers, discussions...).

There's a lot of work. Her due dates are confusing and she can come off tough sometimes but it's not the worst. She's not a tough grader as long as you put in the work you'll be ok. I've forgotten to turn an assignment in before and she penalized me but worked with me. She'll let you know immediately if you're missing something. Good Luck!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She is terrible. I'm in the middle of my semester and had to come here to rate how bad she is as a professor. I honestly don't understand how she is still employed. Unfortunately, you can't avoid her if you choose a marketing-related major or minor. There are numerous assignments with confusing instructions that will consume all your time. Rude too
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Largest workload in my 4 years here. There are three extra credit opportunities and one makeup essay exam at the end of the semester. She also changes requirements for assignments regularly and due dates conflict with each other depending on what document you look at. If you have a lot going on do not take this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment:
There's too much. So, so, so much work. There's 3 exams, 3 different essay categories, with a total of 15 or so essays. Weekly discussions. About 30 minutes of doing homework is figuring out what the homework is and then another hour is spent finding where to turn it in

It's just so much crap to deal with and juggle. I should NEVER have taken this
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The class was a huge workload with weekly papers and presentations. While the professor seemed fine, the assignments were overwhelming and lacked clear direction. Unstuck study AI was a lifesaver for organizing and planning my essays.

She wasn't necessarily a bad teacher, her class's workload is just immense, unlike any other online class I have had. She makes u track ur purchases throughout the semester but then it says (Not a grade) in the grade book but it most definitely is, if you don't do your little journal correctly it can cost you so many points for other assignments.

The material itself is not hard to learn understand, but the workload for this class is a lot. There is a lot of assignments. On top of that, there is a group project that will take the entire semester to work on with so many requirements. This class took my time/focus away from my other classes.

I will say some assignments are very easy but they are just SO much. Everything you do in this class is a written assignment and you'll have to do so much research for sources on these papers. I thought this was going to be a fun class but it ended up being my nightmare. I genuinely feel like I got no new knowledge by taking this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Believe these "red" reviews! I really wish I would've looked on here before taking her class, because everything they are saying is TRUE!! Also, the packback you have to buy is over 100$, so more than the textbook itself, and is required! Please just save yourself the frustration and go somewhere else!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Had her for two classes at once, ended up having 3 essays, 2 exams, and one group project all due over thanksgiving break. DO NOT TAKE! She's a nice person but such a difficult teacher. Her feedback will be longer than your essay!! Pray you get a good group, if not you will fail the class because of it (You can't even pick your group)
I would avoid this class!!

Plz for the love of God DO NOT TAKE HER!!!! you will be stressing the whole semester !! Just a pile of work. I don't rate professors and this Is my first one because I would hate for someone to go through with this class. Even if it's the only class left open plz save yourself until another professor!!
This is one of the toughest classes I have taken at KSU just to be an elective course. This class requires a lot of writing with Essays. When given directions she needs to explain questions better.

One of the worst professors I have taken. Listen to the other reviews. There is a group project that has so much work and will take up more time than any other class. She gives contradicting instructions and nothing is ever good enough for her. You will have to correct your papers multiple times and still receive bad grades. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: As a professor she was fine. But the work that was assigned is what made this class awful. For a class called entertainment marketing you will be shocked with the amount of boring writing assignments you will have.There is at least a 500 word paper due every week with most other weeks having a 1400+ paper & presentation due. Exams are also essays.

probably a nice person but this was an awful online class. don't know why she tries so hard to make it "unique" which makes it extremely difficult to follow... it's just entertainment marketing, take it down a notch to where I can actually learn without being given twenty assignments at a time
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Dear student if you want to learn more about marketing please take another professor. She had multiple assignments due on multiple days of the week. She grades with her emotions in turn you never know what grade you will receive. Probably one of the worst professors I have ever taken.

I haven't left a review since my  freshman year simply bc I have have never cared enough but not leaving a review for this teacher seems like a disservice.  I had the pleasure of taking 2 of her classes this semester and in each class she was constantly mixing up due dates and assigned  multiple 400 word essays every week. DO NOT TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The group project is impossible because she does not give good feedback. She is horrible at responding to emails and will often not answer your questions. The due dates are all over the place, and taking forever to grade made the class even harder. Tests are in lockdown, but you do get the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: There were multiple weeks in the semester where I had three papers and a ten minute presentation due in one week. You have to open and watch all lecture videos, links, resources she will take points off your weekly participation. Super unorganized. Due dates were a mess and did not line up. Heaviest work load in my four years of college.

I took this course online and was in no way shape or form, prepared. Professor Robinson assigns four 200 word discussion posts a week (due on Wednesdays & Saturdays), and you cannot post on the same day or you'll get points off. She's an extremely tough grader and has high expectations of you. Don't take if you enjoy having free time.

I had to create an account just to tell y'all my awful experience. The class is very paper heavy, and she is so unorganized. Assignments either don't exist or due dates don't line up. Don't even get me started on her spelling. She can't spell to save her life. I thought these reviews were dramatic, but I should have listened. DO NOT TAKE!

I have never in my life been expected to write so many discussion posts, essays, logs, and papers for one class. Not even an english class has required me to write as much as this professor requires. Unorganized all around, instructions for assignments usually do not make sense. She seems like a nice woman, but prepare to be overwhelmed & stressed.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I have never in my five years of college had so much work to do. FOUR 200 word discussion posts a week, and have to post what you bought that week. A lot of weeks I would have 5+ assignments due, a lot on the same day. Her syllabus is about 20 pages long. I had less writing in my English 1101 class... DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This class was more difficult than I expected it to be. You have multiple discussion post due a week and it has to be at least 200 words and you have to cite. The test are lockdown with webcam, but you can use your textbook. This class also has a very lengthy group project and sometimes confusing. She also does round your grade if your borderline.

I've never had a professor assign so many assignments in one week. There are times when you have multiple discussions posts, essays, and test due in the same week or even on the same day. It's overwhelming and it makes it difficult to work on other classes. Her lectures are pretty vague which makes the tests really hard. Take someone else!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I would never recommend this professor to anyone.Some things tell you different due dates and she has other semester due dates ran into everything. She has changed the syllabus once a week it seems like. Makes you write about topics that you can barley cover half a page but expects 3 pages single spaced. Most ridiculous class I have ever taken!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Currently a senior on my 8th and final semester at Kennesaw State. Never in my four years here have I had more of a workload and had to write so many essays.

Horrible, paper-heavy. The lectures do not cover the depth of which we are being asked to write to. Plus no textbook to rely on. The directions/expectations for assignments are too vague. I thought I would learn content applicable to my future career, but instead I'm just stressed about writing papers and meeting the word count.

Very very very difficult class. Be prepared to spend all of your time on this class. 2-3 detailed discussions, a quiz and project time every week, it becomes very difficult and overwhelming. That is not even including the three very difficult tests. The group project is not set up very well. Do not recommend taking her class.

Not online savvy and blames her mistakes on her students or the online programs. She should follow a textbook because her lectures were no better than a middle-schoolers presentation. The papers were ridiculously long and unreasonable because she didn't cover enough valuable information in her class to have any substance with your research.

Kid-style class. You have name cards where you have to place on your desk and have to initial each class day for attendance. Any missed days = lose points. not the most understanding. Exams are written, 5 pages each. 2 current event presentations in which you pick topics out. Fun class topic but not the best. Think twice! dismissive..

She is a nice professor, however the workload of this course is insane. For one the discussions posts rules require you to read 80% of the class posts and post twice but they cant be within 24 hrs or points off. There is so much work in this course to the point where it is difficult to keep up unless you have no other classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This professor requires a lot of work! She is nice, available, and willing to help you. she is a nice grader. There is an extensive group company analysis, several DP a week, optional quizzes, tests open e-book, 3 blog essays that are 500 words (not bad actually), consumer purchase blog which you log 3 purchases you made a week. Its manageable..
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Very good professor overall, while her grading can vary just learn from your mistakes as she puts in a good amount of feedback to learn from. She taught me a lot in her class and was very interesting the whole way through. Overall would recommend taking her class!

Professor Robinson is fantastic, but the course is difficult to keep up with if you're not on top of all the due dates/work. Work was due every Wednesday & Saturday. Make sure you keep up with ALL the discussion posts - there's a lot (but they are helpful). She is very kind and communicative! WORK AHEAD. I would take her again, though!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Concepts are not difficult, but class schedule is VERY rigorous. She makes this clear from the start. If you are taking a lot of classes or working, then it is overload. Tackle assignments EARLY. Groups for project are assigned by her, so CHOOSE A STRONG GROUP LEADER!!! She's available DAILY to help, use her! You'll learn A LOT! Don't get behind!

The class was easy, it was just confusing the way that it was presented. The syllabus dates changed throughout the semester, and it was not clear when things were do. If you are a person who works ahead, then it is not a big deal but if you wait until the last minute to do work, then good luck because due dates are confusing. She was helpful though

DO NOT TAKE
IN ALL OF MY CLASSES, I HAVE NEVER HAD AN EXPERIENCE THIS BAD. TERRIBLE ATTITUDE, DOESN'T WANT TO HELP STUDENTS. WAYYYYYYYYYYYY TOO MANY PAPERS.
Not good. So many conflicting and confusing instructions. Worst professor I have ever taken a class with.

took her for mktg 3800 & mktg 3150. this was consumer behavior & entertainment mktg .We had a use 4 diff platforms. She closed things early. instead of asking why we cant see things she would just give us zeros. She has no intention of adapting to internet & the ways behind it. being an online course, she should be able to be more savvy about it.

Subject concepts were not hard but the prof made the material more difficult than it needed to be. Gave multiple attempts to improve group project grade but there were a number of assignments that didn't add real value to the learning experience - busy work. Burn out & info overload happened and excellent time/schedule management were required.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Overall this is the worst online professor I have ever had. The use of her platform she makes is confusing to students considering half of her class dropped out. I however stayed through the 36 discussions 4 consumer blog essays 12 consumer blog post and 1 big group exam that she expects 8 people to work with on 5 different parts. STAY AWAY !!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Solid choice for Marketing professor! Her exams are proctored and lockdown but they are open note and open book. Exams are 32 questions and a short essay. group project throughout the course but she lets you revise your project each time to get a better grade. Quizzes are optional, lots of discussion posts. Gives great feedback

Hardest class I have ever taken & had her for 2 classes this semester. Discussions and 2 replies every week and MUST be posted on separate days. Semester long project could be good, but her feedback is harsh and degrading. Told my group we totally missed the point of the class and told us to Google a question we had for her. Pls take someone else.

Heres the deal, as a professor she gave many chances to improve our projects and tests and even offers extra credit. All of this is in vain though, because she throws assignment after assignment at you until you have no life left. Every two days a lengthy discussion post. do yourself a favor, take another professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment: 36 chapter discussions, 12 consumer blogs, 3 module essays, 3 exams, group project with 7 due dates for various parts, vague feedback, no slack, overall annoying personality. The work itself is not hard if you can somehow understand what shes saying but geez, thats so much work along with other classes. Dont take her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Extremely confusing instruction. TONS OF ASSIGNMENTS. Has attitude when students point out she did something incorrectly. DO NOT RECOMMEND unless you want to spend a ridiculous amount of time working on this class. Takes off points for things she doesn't even specify for. Huge group project and Ridiculous amount of discussion posts.

Its clear she wants all of her students to understand the subject. But she does this by assigning an asinine amount of work. 3 locked down exams, 1 semester-long group project (pretty much 3 projects), 2 disc. posts/week (2 posts on 2 different days for each), and a blog project (3 papers). Keep up and u will do fine. Not hard, just a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: She is terrible. There are 64 assignments in total for her course. Four due every single week and they are not just simple and quick assignments. On top of that, they cannot be done on the same day so you will have to do something every single day of the week for the class. She takes off an absurd amount of points for anything and everything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I have taken Prof Robinson for three different classes and advertising was one of them. Lots of assignments, group paper, and large exceptions so why give her 5 stars? Her class is very easy to follow and allows for make up credit on group papers. Assignments are kinda fun and tests are straight from the text. Take her is you enjoy creating!

Professor Robinson is a tough professor. However, take advantage of her office hours. She is always there to help outside of class. She provides a lot of feedback on the work you submit. She also gives you multiple chances to correct your work in the group project and gives a lot of extra credit. She gives a lot of work and discussions though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: You will have lots of assignments but she will help you. make sure to take advantage of her office hours! The group project takes most of the semester and is a lot of work. Come to class and make sure to turn everything in.
You work on a group project basically the whole semester where she grades EXTREMELY hard on every section. Terrible professor
Assigns an absurd amount of homework and is completely inept at how to even make an online class function properly. Do not take unless you have to.

Professor requires so much work due each week. I took three other courses including a statistics course during the same semester and this was by far the hardest and most time consuming out of the three, but through it all I also learned the most in this course. Shes a good professor just be prepared to do the work. she gives a lot of extra credit

Dr. Robinson will def make you work for your grade. I highly suggest you make lots of notes and pay attention. Exams are difficult but doable. Don't be afraid to ask questions, video conference her to ask questions---she loves that. Take advantage of the extra credit. Do all discussion questions.

HEAVY on extra assignments that don't contribute to your knowledge of the course. DO NOT take this professor unless you want to devote 15+ hours to her class each week. It's insane. Group project is grueling. Feedback on assignments is patchy and unclear. She sends out condescending emails to students, as well.

theres atleast 4 discussions post due in a week and they cant be posted on the same day. along with that you have a huge group project with assignments related to it due every other week. grades are slow and you kind of need the feed back to start working on the next group assignment. tests aren't hard but its the amount of busy work she gives out.

The reason why this teacher is hilarious cause her expectations are a complete joke. Under a pandemic, forced online only classes and multiple sets of classes she expect her's to be the most important. 4 sets of fake discussions per week, essays, a complete business breakdown. Oh, and she'll blame you for not keeping up with her pace.

She's the type of professor that thinks her class is the only one you're in and assigns homework as such. 6-8 assignments a week, including essays and exams due on the same day with no time to study due to the sheer amount of busy work assigned. Completely irrational but thinks everything she does is perfect. Avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took 5 classes over the summer semester, and I 100% had more assignments for this class than all my others combined. Do not slack off. Discussion posts are constantly due, so stay on top of it. Overall, she's a sweet and gives great feedback and extra credit, but she's a TOUGH professor. Class is passable, but it's not gonna be fun or easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Ok like the class is not hard it's just a lot of work and research and papers and discussions and team projects and consumers blogs. You just be like when is it going to end! I got so lucky I had a good group because I have never had to do so much work in my life this is not a class you want to retake, not because it's hard, just the amount of work
rating_tags: So many papers--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: The most disorganized class layout I've had during my years at KSU. The frequency of assignments and group projects is ridiculous. There are assignments that "aren't for a grade" but that actually do count for a portion of another grade. She has absolutely no idea how to run an efficient class. It's a clusterf*ck.

As if the class isn't difficult enough, the professor makes it even harder. The group project is absolutely ridiculous and confusing. There are FOUR discussions a week. If I wasn't waist deep, I would drop. I advise taking any other class. This one class is a bigger load than my other 3 put together.

This class is difficult for the sake of being difficult - not to facilitate learning. The course layout is so confusing. Take any other professor and save yourself a headache. Professor Robinson clearly cares a lot, but she just doesn't do a great job with the online platform. Seriously, I know you're thinking, "it can't be that bad". It is though.
Please do yourself a favor and avoid this professor at all costs. 4 discussion posts a week and they can't be posted on the same day. So much work is expected for this one class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: I don't ever use Rate My Professor but if I can help somebody avoid a semester of unnecessary stress, confusing instructions and just overall ridiculous busy work I will. Do not take her. The semester isn't even over and I can already tell that taking her class online was a mistake. She is unorganized and unclear with everything.

DO NOT TAKE! I have never rated one of my professors, but I often rely on their ratings. Sometimes I read the reviews with ease, but this class is NO JOKE. Whenever you feel like you can take a breathe and work on/study for another course, there are 5 more assignments due within a few days. Hardest course I've ever taken, and its an elective...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This is the worst online class I have ever taken. Confusing set up and so much work.

The feedback is all over the place. Templated responses, tons of reading and too much work for 3 credit hours. Instructions were all over the place and she did not know how to use D2L in an efficient manor. Spent a lot of time trying to figure out what she wanted and where the "right" instructions were.

she makes it TERRIBLE.I usually can put up with bad professors and get through It, but she actually made my life terrible.... SO many things to keep up with.. the class work is a work load of about 3 classes put together and on top of that she's very rude. do not listen to people that said "not that bad" bc they are probably lying.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I'm not sure how her version of this class not online is like, but get ready to put some time aside for all the assignments she has. She requires 4 discussion posts a week that can't be posted on the same day. She assigns all these different things, but can barely get your grades or feedback in a timely manner. Could be clearer in her instructions.

This class requires A LOT. I'm doing this rating mid semester, that's how serious I am. Don't take this class if you're taking more than 6 hours. This professor doesn't care if you're taking other classes, there's literally something due everyday. One week there was 11 assignments due in this ONE class. I'm not even learning anything at this point.

Professor gives insanely long feedbacks on each section of project, never good enough even if you follow directions exactly. Final group paper nearly 50 pages long and had to be redone all the time. Required discussions and responses weekly, quizzes, exams. You need to be organized to be successful, and hope you got a good group.

I've never had a professor as inconsiderate as Laura Robinson. She thoroughly believes that her class is more important than any other class you take. The class consisted of assignments due every day, along with a group project that lasted throughout the semester. Choose another professor, because no assignment is ever good enough. Thank me later!
To keep it short, if you take her, I hope you enjoy a tedious workload and don't enjoy your free time. What a mistake I made by thinking "It couldn't be that bad." Good Luck!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Avoid taking her online consumer behavior class. In addition to the excessive amount of work and posts required, she assigns a group project. No matter what you do she will never be satisfied with your work and gives unclear feedback.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The Course work is a lot! quizzes about every week, papers, 3 tests & a group project all semester long. This is the only class I have ever taken that has given me this MUCH WORK for a IN PERSON CLASS. Attendance is for a every day grade. She is very sweet, and loves her job but do not take unless you have no choice.

I took this course online. The course work got to be overwhelming but I persevered. Discussion post every week, purchase blog entry, timed quizzes, and test. If you don't take good notes from the book you wont pass. I suggest typing them and staple in a notebook. She only allows hand written notes but its way to time consuming. Group project.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Getting a group project in an online class is ridiculous to begin with. With 6-8 assignments a week we were overloaded with work, and her explanations are so long and foggy it is hard to understand what she is asking of you. DO NOT TAKE!
Ms. Robinson is a great person and knows what she is talking about, however the coursework is extensive and feedback is tremendous. Be prepared to work on this class a lot
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Laura is really sweet but the amount of assignments she assigns is a little ridiculous. One week alone you will have 6-8 things due. If you complete all the assignments exactly how she wants it then you can get an A but it is by no means easy because she is very picky.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: An overall terrible class. Can not keep up with what she assigns & she assigns too much expecting you to live at her class. So with this combination things will fall through the cracks on both her side and the student's side. If you have her during the summer be prepared to loose your life to work. All busy work and no learning.

Very sweet, but so much work required for this class. It's easy to pass if you do all the work, but it's very demanding. 2-4 discussion posts due a week. three tests, a quiz for each chapter, a semester long group project, and three essays. I would take again because the course is an easy A if you have the time to commit to it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class is more time consuming then any class i have ever taken. Constant discussion posts even over break, have to "read" everyone's replies. As well as monthly group projects that take hours upon hours for every assignment. DO NOT TAKE unless you can commit an average of 3-6 hours every week on this class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! She really cares that a student succeeds. Online tests, 3 module blog essays (only time you will use the book because you have to reference it), easy chapter quizzes online, daily group work and gives so much feed back and opportunities to try for a better grade. At first I considered dropping bc it sounded like so much but easy!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: hate this class. do not take her. so much work and its not worth it. grades the project so hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Robinson seems like she's invested in her class. However, her 3150 class is unrealistic. 4 discussions per week, but for full credit they all need to be 24 hours apart. She admits her class is mostly busy work. Don't take her online if you have more than 4 classes. Her class honestly ruined consumer behavior for me which should be interesting
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: easy A but she is unorganized. I'm taking her consumer behavior 3150 now and that will probably be an easy A as well.
As everyone else has stated, there is a lot of work (busy work) for this class. If you keep up with her due dates then you should be ok. On a positive note, she is not a super harsh grader.

I had two 4000 level classes at the same time as this class. Her class had more work then both my 4000 level class combined. 4 discussion posts per week(200 word min for each post.) 4 tests, 18 chapter quizzes, weekly blog posts, 3 essays, oh and HUGE group project worth 35% of your grade. If you don't have to take her, avoid it. I wish I had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: SO. MUCH. HOMEWORK. This is an elective class for most people, and I've had the work of what I normally had for 2 classes. The group project is horrendous, and it's 35% of your grade. The specifics of what she wants are not laid out well. She gives a chance to edit, but even after the first edit, I had to scrap it and start over.

TONS OF WORK! Multiple discussion posts of 200+ words per week + you have to read 80% of everyones posts. The report is very, very time consuming and lengthy/detailed. Multiple quizzes. Tests are multiple choice + short answer worth 25% of the test grade. DO NOT take online. She doesnt understand we have 3-5 other classes as well. Would not take.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Super easy class, unfortunately there's an attendance policy. There's a lot of busywork, but it's easy. Tests are online and open note. Group paper/project. She's super nice and very quirky. You'd have to try not to get an A!

Don't be put off by the work. There is a lot of it, but it is mostly small, simple assignments that come in groups. She lays everything out very clearly for when it's due, and ALL TEST QUESTIONS CAN BE FOUND ONLINE (there is one essay and the test is timed, which is a little scary). Overall, straightforward. Just stay on top of your group paper!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is quirky and unclear about assignments, but she is approachable & truly cares about students learning. The only downside is that there is a TON of work, but she is not a harsh grader and gives you many opportunities to succeed. Lots of research, paper writing, quizzes, DB posts, and a few tests. Group project is a major part of final grade.

This teacher claims that she doesn't offer "busy work" but we literally have 2 discussion posts due every 3 days along with other assignments. Its just such an unnecessary amount of work that really is more annoying than it is beneficial. 1 discussion post a week makes sense. Not 4. So so so unnecessary.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There is a lot of work but it is not overly difficult in content. You just have to keep up with it, and she is very understanding

Structures the class with a lot of busy work and time requirements for turning it in that make getting the work done difficult. Hard to know what exactly she wants from the group project until she returns it, and even when you use her corrections she still finds issues with it. The only good thing is that the quizzes and exam are not difficult.

Really surprised by the bad reviews here... Loved her class, fun discussions. Group project is really important. Tests and quizzes are easy. She has been the most helpful professor I've had. She wants you to succeed in her class and will make sure you have the tools to do so. Very impressive lady with many accomplishments.

This class was definitely one of my more relaxed classes. Lectures are interesting and she likes to try to engage the class in discussions. There are papers to write like once a month but they are very easy. Takes me under an hour to write them. The group project is a huge part of her class but she GIVES you class time to work with your team!

Robinson was absolutely fantastic. The majority of the class work was online and the test/quizzes were extremely simple. Can exempt the final if you have less than 3 absences. The hardest portion of the class is the group project and she gives feedback throughout the semester to make sure you do well. Love her more than my mother.

Took online, LOTS of busy work. Remember high school? Complicated layout on D2L, and the group project takes group coordination because it's online.  Lots of quizzes but they are easy, and LOTS of discussion posts that just get so irritating.

Here's the truth. Great online teacher who actually put effort into her class instead of relying on the textbook to do her job. But there's a LOT of work. Many discussion posts, quizzes and tests. Oh, and if you get a crappy team then you are screwed. The project is a MONSTER but she lets you correct every part. If you fail, you deserved it.

The class is easy, but so so so much work. The teacher is clear on assignments and it is clear she cares about you learning. The group project is hard but she grades different parts separately and let's you correct them.

Easy class but SO MUCH WORK!!!!!!! Its an online class so we have 2 post on wednesdays and 2 post on saturdays, each 200 words. Plus 2 quizzes a week and another blog. Textbook is needed. Grading takes awhile. Nice professor but expect to do a lot of work!

Robinson is a good professor. The course requires A LOT of work. BUT, the work isn't hard at all. It's just busy work. A few essays. I barely put effort into my essays and I still got a 100 on all of them. I put in the minimal effort. Tests are online, but in class. Use your resources. For the most part, easy A. Attendance mandatory.

This professor is completely unorganized in every way. She gives an unreasonable amount of busy work. She puts grading on the back burner ALWAYS. Grades are due tomorrow and she still hasn't finished grading exams from mid-semester. She always has some excuse for not grading. "Taxes".. "Sickness". IT'S NOT THAT HARD. Lazy professor

Tons and Tons of work. A if you put the effort in B if you want to post. To succeed in the class you need to have  a great group. Project counts for a huge portion of the grade. extremely easy tests and discussions. Took as an elective class, wouldn't take again due to the work load in her online 4150 class.

She gives a stupid amount of work. Again, she gives a ridiculously stupid amount of work. She does not take into account the fact that we are college students and have other classes besides hers. The entire class is basically built around a group marketing project; so if you believe in a God, pray to it you don't a worthless group. Do not recommend

Awful. 2 quizzes a week that are due before class plus a semester long group project plus individual papers plus tests. She can't even keep up with the grading and is rude in her criticism. Half the time she gave me feedback meant for her other class. Lectures are pointless but required. She is never specific and is one of the worst communicators.

If you are a marketing major this class may help you. If you are one of the other majors and couldn't care less about this class don't take her. She gives a ridiculous amount of work for an intro marketing class that no one cares about. Seriously do not take her if you don't want to do an absurd amount of work for a pointless class.

She is a super nice lady and great professor. Wants you to succeed. Super clear about what she wants. You can fix your mistakes in the group projects to get a better grade. Easy online tests and quizzes. Very easy class if you keep up with the work. I would definitely recommend her. Buy the book for the tests. Attendance is not required.

Professor Robinson is such a sweet southern lady! I loved her and her class. It was definitely no easy A. You do have to work for your grade but in the process you actually learn, unlike some other classes. Group projects were a little difficult and VERY time consuming, however, if you pick a good group you'll be just fine! :)

When I first started in professor Robinson's class I thought that I was dealing with a difficult professor. It turns out, I was dealing with a great teacher. Her class is one of the few that I can truly say will benefit me in my career. I recommend this class to anyone who is serious about learning concepts that you can apply in your life after KSU

This professor was organized and helpful. I actually learned something. Coming to class is a must but if you miss a day or two you should be ok. She gives multiple chances and choices on doing assignments. She can be a bit rude sometimes, but she has a MBA and people do not realized she isn't just a farm owning professor.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. You have to do 4 long discussion posts every week, 4 hard tests that she only gives you 50 min to complete, and a huge group project. The project was the most stressful and ridiculous thing I've ever experienced in my 4 years of college. She expects way too much out of you for an online class and is very rude.

Professor Robinson has good intentions but she is one of the worst professors I have ever had at KSU. She is extremely unclear about what she wants and her instructions are completely inconsistent. I have a 3.85 and this was the hardest class I have ever taken. I don't recommend her but if you have to take this class, just prepare for the worst.

Professor Robinson was the worst professor I have ever had at KSU. She is unorganized and has unrealistic expectations. The amount of work required for her class is insulting. Rather than wanting to see her students succeed, she sets them up for failure. I wish I would have listened to the students before me. I would not recommend her to anyone.

Absolutely deplorable. She is unorganized and rude, and unapologetic for both. An overwhelming amount of work for the material and very little instruction on what she wants. I would recommend this professor to absolutely NO ONE. She lacks the skills and character required to be a successful instructor. I'm embarrassed that she represents my school.

I took this class online and it was extremely overwhelming. We had 4 discussions due every week (and you are not supposed to discuss from the book or you will get points off) and a huge group project that she doesn't really help too much on. She is slow on getting back to us and is extremely scatter brained. Too much work given and not enough time.

Relatively easy. More than fair share of busy work but none of it is hard. Tries to go through too many chapters. But nice, flexible, and willing to help. Tests are book generated and hard, but open book and open note. Group work.

The point of this class is NOT to learn. The students teach the class all semester and then you're tested on questions generated by the book. You can take quizzes online to memorize them. Her class is disorganized and confusing. She also grades team projects really hard and seemingly arbitrarily. Don't take if you want a fair, useful experience.

I took her online and she doesn't interact much after the first or second week. Weekly discussions over 1 or 2 chapters, Blog Essays relating documented purchases to concepts in the chapters. Tests are easier if you take the optional practice quizzes. A few group projects are required but are not bad if you have a good group to communicate with. A+

Alot of busy work with this online class. Between discussions,team case studies, and reading the text. Exams cover 5 chapters each.Would not recommend for a summer class but OK during a regular semester.

Online Spring '07--The syllabus is confusing & sounds harsh, but the class is not that hard. The group project is not that bad (given you have a decent group). Tests are hard if you don't take it upon yourself to memorize everything in the chapters--expect to learn 5 chapters at a time and take tests every 2-3 weeks (4 tests total--weekly disc req.
